PostgreSQL (Postgres for short)

  • RDBMS 
    • how to define records (data definition)
    • CRUD, in a performant way(B-Trees (self balancing tree w/ quicker access times, etc)
    • Administration
  • NoSQL databases - easier to pick up on your own
  • developed since 1970s so robust
  • different command tools
    • psql - command line
    • Postico - GUI
  • Postgres process
    • waiting for incoming SQL
      • psql CLI 
      • GUI like Postico
    • knows how to read/write
    • sends back results
  • Postgres is a TCP server
    • listening on a TCP port for requests
    • does disk access
    • sends back a TCP response to the client that made the requests
    • not followingHTTP protocol 
    • uses postgress:// protocol
      • uses TCP/IP in transport 
      • content type is SQL rather than HTML, JSON, XML, TXT
  • Node-postgres
    • Nom install pg —save
    • db driver, implement postgress protocol in a Node module 
    • gives us a client object that we can pass SQL to
    • asynchronously talks via postgres protocol over TCP to Postgres
    • gives us a callback with rows array of resulting table
    • Returning
      • SQL comes in slightly different ‘dialects’ depending on your RDBMS (SQLite, MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc
      • PostgresSQL has ‘returning’ keyword, used during INSERT, UPDATE
      • returns the rows inserted/updated
